result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. LeFevre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Christopher M. LeFevre

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLY TO BOTH COUNTS.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Continue to work with Human Services as long as RL is under juvenile order.    Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 yrs. upon completion of all conditions and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from DOC.  If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Wendy Wiggins Lemkuil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State files amended information. Court reviews charges in amended information including max. penalties. Defense waives reading of the amended information.   Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court grants defendant 24 hours to remove firearms from his home.  Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre appears by phone. Attorney Aileen Henry appears in person.  Wendy Wiggins Lemkuil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Henry indicates she has a new offer from the State, requests short adjournment to allow her time to discuss offer with defendant with hopes of resolution. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.
from Atty Henry requesting adjournment of 8/17/17 hearing. Court grants request.
Status conference on August 17, 2017 at 11:00 am.
under Chapter 978
Jury trial on August 29, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre and attorney Aileen Henry appear by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews defendant's request to adjourn December trial. Court reviews State's objection to the adjournment. Atty Henry makes short statement. State concerned that case has been pending for a year and a half and they have many witnesses subpoenaed. State also concerned that if matter is adjourned, trial may not get back on the calendar for a while. Court makes statement, grants defendants motion to adjourn trial.  Court will have JA put together some possible jury dates and contact counsel to set the new trial date.  Bond remains in effect.
from Atty Henry requesting adjournment of trial. Court responds-does DA object, if so, set hearing. Atty Henry & Def. can appear by phone.
Hearing on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Preliminary Hearing dated October 7, 2015
from ADA Korb objecting to adjournment of trial.
Change of attorney
from Atty Henry requesting phone appearance for 10/24/16 hearing.

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre and attorney Aileen Henry appear by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court questions Atty Henry whether she would be ready to try case in January 2017. Atty Henry is meeting with defendant next week, will be picking up case file from PD office tomorrow, suggests leaving the status date on the calendar for 12/19/16. Court would like to hear from Atty Henry before Dec. 19 court date if she will be requesting an adjournment of the trial. Atty Henry will let court know status of trial after meeting with defendant. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defendant indicates he's contacted the public defenders office about getting new counsel appointed. They told him they haven't seen anything from Atty Nordin requesting new counsel be appointed. Court will follow matter up in a couple weeks. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
for withdrawl of counsel

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre appears by phone with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin who appears in person. Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Atty Nordin needs to withdraw from the case as the trial date is after the first of the year in which she will be starting her new position as the district attorney on January 1, 2017. State objects to adjournment of the trial. Atty Nordin is hoping that new atty appointed may be able to try the case in January, if not, trial may have to be adjourned. Court orders Atty Nordin to immediately notify the PD office to have new counsel appointed.  Atty Nordin will present consent and order to withdraw from the case for court to sign.  State requests a status in a couple weeks to see where PD's office is at in appointing a new atty. Defendant can appear by phone for 10/10/16 status. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from ADA Korb requesting a status at the courts earliest convenience. Court sets hearing.
Status conference on September 22, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
from ADA Korb requesting adjournment of trial as one of their witnesses is not available. Court reschedules.
Jury trial on January 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial at 08-16-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 07-14-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Nordin just received the transcripts from the fact finding hearing, hasn't had a chance to go through all of them yet. Atty Nordin indicates the State won't be amending their offer, asks court to set matter for trial. Court will set matter for pretrial and trial in a #1 position. (4 day trial). Pretrial to be set a month before the jury trial. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Nordin requests a status in January after the CHIPS matter. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Christopher M. LeFevre in court with attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Inv. Connie Schuster testifies, sworn. State Exh. #1 - photo of bedroom, #2 - statement from Christopher LeFevre. Both exhibits offered and received. Inv. Cross. Chris Neuville testifies, sworn. Exh. #3 - medical record for infant from St. Vincent Hospital, #4 - Exh. 4 - medical report from Dr. Knox. Both exhibits offered and received. Cross. Atty Korb makes statement, feels there is probable cause to bind defendant over. Defense doesn't feels the State has met their burden, a Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and probable cause that defendant committed that felony and binds over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 11:15 am.
